analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa'i bde ba dang / bsil ba dang / bdud rtsi lta bu'i mya ngan las 'das pa chen po tshol bar rigs so //
translated: I am one who has the nature of birth, the nature of aging, the nature of sickness, and the nature of death. In that way, it is fitting for me to seek the great nirvana, which is free from birth, free from aging, free from sickness, free from death, free from suffering, free from heat, and is like nectar.

original: nges par srid pa las grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gcig po yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nges par srid pa las grol ba'i mya ngan las 'das par 'gro ba'i lam gcig po yin pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de yi lam ni btsal bar bya //

original: de nas lhag par yang bsams pa //

translated: Then, I thought even more:

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i bde ba zhes bya ba yod do //

analyzed: de ltar mi mthun phyogs srid pa yod na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro snyam /

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i phung por skyes bu 'gyel bar gyur pa zhig thag ring po nas kha dog lnga dang ldan pa'i padma dang / mtsho chen po mthong na lam gang nas 'gro bar byas nas mtsho der 'jug par rigs so //

translated: If a man who has fallen into the five-colored lotus pond as explained above sees from afar a great lake, he should enter that lake by going along the path.

original: de'i lam du mi 'gro na mtsho chen po'i skyon ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i lam du mi 'gro na mtsho chen po'i skyon ma yin no //

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khrud pa na 'chi ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mtsho chen po yod pa na der mi 'jug na /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa'i dri ma 'khrud pa na 'chi ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba'i mtsho chen po yod pa na der mi 'jug na /
translated: When the stains of afflictions are washed away in this way, one enters the great lake of deathless nirvana.

original: 'chi ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtsho chen po'i skyon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtsho chen po'i skyon ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when the stains of the afflictions are washed away, there is the great lake of deathless nirvana. If one does not enter it, it is not the fault of the great lake of deathless nirvana.

original: ji ltar yang chom rkun pas yongs su bskor ba'i skyes bu 'bros pa'i lam yod pa la myur du mi 'bros na lam gyi skyon ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yang chom rkun pas yongs su bskor ba'i skyes bu 'bros pa'i lam yod pa la myur du mi 'bros na lam gyi skyon ma yin te /

original: skyes bu'i skyon yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i skyon yin no //
translated: It is the fault of the person.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pas yongs su bskor nas bzung ba'i skyes bu la zhi ba mya ngan las 'da' ba'i lam yod par gyur pa na lam mi tshol ba na lam gyi skyon ma yin te /

translated: Thus, when a person seized and surrounded by the afflictions has the path to the peace of nirvana, if they do not seek the path, it is not the fault of the path.

original: gang zag gi skyon yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gi skyon yin no //

translated: alone, he relies on the mountain called Dharma Snow.

original: der lo ma'i khang par 'chag par byed cing skyon lnga po ma bzlog lam spangs bzhin du de ltar sems mnyam par bzhag pa dang po dang / byed pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i mngon par shes pas smras pa dang / stobs len pa dang / de ru gnas te skyon dgu dang ldan pa gyon pa'i gos spangs nas /
analyzed: der lo ma'i khang par 'chag par byed cing skyon lnga po ma bzlog lam spangs bzhin du de ltar sems mnyam par bzhag pa dang po dang / byed pa brgyad dang ldan pa'i mngon par shes pas smras pa dang / stobs len pa dang / de ru gnas te skyon dgu dang ldan pa gyon pa'i gos spangs nas /
translated: ‚ÄúTake strength and live there, abandoning the clothes with the nine faults.

original: yon tan bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing shun gyi dum bu'i gos gyon nas /
analyzed: yon tan bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing shun gyi dum bu'i gos gyon nas /
translated: Wear the bark cloth with the twelve good qualities.

original: drang srong gi rab tu byung ba la rab tu byung ste /
analyzed: drang srong gi rab tu byung ba la rab tu byung ste /
translated: Go forth in the going forth of the ·πõ·π£is.

original: de ltar rab tu byung nas skron brgyad dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i khang bde spangs nas yon tan bcu dang ldan pa'i shing gi drung du nye bar gnas so //üîΩ'byor pa thams cad spangs nas shing @279a *//
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung nas skron brgyad dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i khang bde spangs nas yon tan bcu dang ldan pa'i shing gi drung du nye bar gnas so // 'byor pa thams cad spangs nas shing @279a *//
translated: Having gone forth, abandon the leaf hut with the eight faults and stay at the foot of a tree with the ten good qualities.

original: gi 'bras bu mchog za zhing 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: gi 'bras bu mchog za zhing 'dug pa'o //
translated: Abandon all wealth and eat the supreme fruit of the tree.

original: gnas su 'chag par byed pa'i dka' thub byed do //
analyzed: gnas su 'chag par byed pa'i dka' thub byed do //
translated: Practice the austerity of walking in the place.

original: zhag bdun gyi nang de nyid du brgyad la snyoms par 'jug cing mngon shes lnga po thob par gyur te /
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi nang de nyid du brgyad la snyoms par 'jug cing mngon shes lnga po thob par gyur te /
translated: Within seven days, he entered the eighth stage and attained the five superknowledges.

original: de bzhin du des don du gnyer bas mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin du des don du gnyer bas mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob par gyur to //
translated: In the same way, he attained the power of superknowledge through striving for the goal.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de ltar bdag gis bsams gyur pa //
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis bsams gyur pa //
translated: Thus I thought:

original: sna tshogs byed pa brgya yi nor //
analyzed: sna tshogs byed pa brgya yi nor //
translated: I will give the wealth of a hundred various deeds

original: mgon dang mgon med rnams la sbyin //
analyzed: mgon dang mgon med rnams la sbyin //
translated: to those with protectors and those without protectors.

original: gangs can la ni nye bar song //
analyzed: gangs can la ni nye bar song //
translated: I will go to the snowy mountains.

original: gangs can dang ni mi ring bar //
analyzed: gangs can dang ni mi ring bar //
translated: Not far from the snowy mountains,

original: chos kyi ri zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: chos kyi ri zhes bya ba la //
translated: on a mountain called Dharma,

original: bdag gis de la mchog tu rten //
analyzed: bdag gis de la mchog tu rten //
translated: I will rely on it as supreme.

original: lo ma'i khang pa legs byas so //
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa legs byas so //
translated: I will make a leaf hut.üîΩThere I will walk,

original: de ru 'chag par byed pa dang // skyon ni lnga po rnam par spangs /
analyzed: de ru 'chag par byed pa dang // skyon ni lnga po rnam par spangs /
translated: having abandoned the five faults,

original: yon tan brgyad dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: yon tan brgyad dang yang dag ldan //
translated: endowed with the eight good qualities,

original: mngon par shes pa'i stobs ldan no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i stobs ldan no //
translated: having the power of superknowledge.

original: skyon dgu dang ni ldan pa yi //
analyzed: skyon dgu dang ni ldan pa yi //
translated: Endowed with the nine faults,

original: der ni de nyid dor gyur nas //
analyzed: der ni de nyid dor gyur nas //
translated: having abandoned that very [leaf hut],

original: shing shun dum bu'i gos gyon to //
analyzed: shing shun dum bu'i gos gyon to //
translated: I will wear bark cloth garments.

original: yon tan bcu gnyis ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan bcu gnyis ldan pa'o //
translated: and endowed with twelve qualities.üîΩHaving abandoned the leaf-hut

original: skyon ni brgyad dang ldan pa yi //üîΩlo ma'i khang pa spangs gyur nas //
analyzed: skyon ni brgyad dang ldan pa yi // lo ma'i khang pa spangs gyur nas //
translated: endowed with eight faults,

original: shing gi drung du nye bar 'dug /üîΩyon tan bcu dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: shing gi drung du nye bar 'dug / yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yi //
translated: he sat down at the foot of a tree.üîΩHaving abandoned the grains

original: rmos dang bskrun pa'i 'bru rnams ni //
analyzed: rmos dang bskrun pa'i 'bru rnams ni //
translated: sown and planted

original: lhag ma med par dor byas nas //üîΩyon tan ma lus ldan pa yi //
analyzed: lhag ma med par dor byas nas // yon tan ma lus ldan pa yi //
translated: without remainder,üîΩhe first ate the best fruit

original: shing tog mchog ni dang por zos //
analyzed: shing tog mchog ni dang por zos //
translated: endowed with all qualities.

original: de ru @279b dka' thub byas nas ni //
analyzed: de ru @279b dka' thub byas nas ni //
translated: Having practiced austerities there,

original: 'dug dang 'chag pa'i gnas rnams su //
analyzed: 'dug dang 'chag pa'i gnas rnams su //
translated: in the places of sitting and walking,

original: zhag bdun gyi ni nang nyid du //
analyzed: zhag bdun gyi ni nang nyid du //
translated: within seven days

original: mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob bo //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob bo //
translated: he attained the power of superknowledge.

original: 'dir yang gleng gzhi ni mkhas nga blo gros bzang po brten pa'i lo ma'i khang pa dang / 'chag pa ni rang gi lag gis byas pa ltar brjod do //
analyzed: 'dir yang gleng gzhi ni mkhas nga blo gros bzang po brten pa'i lo ma'i khang pa dang / 'chag pa ni rang gi lag gis byas pa ltar brjod do //
translated: Here, the setting is described as a leaf-hut of the wise and the good, and the walking is said to be like that done by one's own hand.

original: 'dir yang don ni sems pa chen po gangs can gyi nang nas 'ongs pa dang / de ring chos kyi rir yongs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: 'dir yang don ni sems pa chen po gangs can gyi nang nas 'ongs pa dang / de ring chos kyi rir yongs pa mthong nas /
translated: Here, the meaning is that having seen the great-minded one come from the snowy land and arrive today at the mountain of Dharma,

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis las sna tshogs pa'i lha'i bu la mkhas pa blo gros bzang po 'di ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas song ste /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis las sna tshogs pa'i lha'i bu la mkhas pa blo gros bzang po 'di ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas song ste /
translated: ≈öakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the son of gods Skilled in Various Things, ‚ÄúThis one of good intellect wishes to go forth.

original: 'di'i gnas rnams kyis gcig de'i tshig thos nas dga' ba'i gnas phug legs par lo ma'i khang par 'chag pa'i gnas byas so //
analyzed: 'di'i gnas rnams kyis gcig de'i tshig thos nas dga' ba'i gnas phug legs par lo ma'i khang par 'chag pa'i gnas byas so //
translated: Having heard his words, one of his companions went to the leaf hut, which was a good place for walking meditation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang de'i tshe bdag gis bsams nas goms par byas pa rdzogs pa las de'i dus su de'i rgyu mtshan gyis sh'a ri'i bu der chos kyi ri der /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yang de'i tshe bdag gis bsams nas goms par byas pa rdzogs pa las de'i dus su de'i rgyu mtshan gyis sh'a ri'i bu der chos kyi ri der /
translated: The Blessed One, having thought about this, said, ‚ÄúAt that time, I completed my practice. At that time, for that reason, ≈öƒÅriputra, I made that place a good place for the Dharma.

original: gnas bzang po ni bdag gis byas //
analyzed: gnas bzang po ni bdag gis byas //
translated: I made a good place there,

original: lo ma'i khang pa bzang por ldan //
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa bzang por ldan //
translated: With a good leaf hut.

original: der ni 'chag cing gnas nas ni //
analyzed: der ni 'chag cing gnas nas ni //
translated: There, while walking and staying,

original: skyon lnga po ni rnam par spangs //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyon lnga po ni rnam par spangs // zhes gsungs so //
translated: I abandoned the five faults.‚Äù

original: 'chag pa'i skyon lnga po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chag pa'i skyon lnga po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five faults of walking meditation?

original: sra zhing mi snyoms pa dang / nang na shing rang rod can dang / nags thibs po dang / shin tu dog pa dang / shin tu yangs pa'o //üîΩsra zhing mi snyoms pa'i @280a *//
analyzed: sra zhing mi snyoms pa dang / nang na shing rang rod can dang / nags thibs po dang / shin tu dog pa dang / shin tu yangs pa'o // sra zhing mi snyoms pa'i @280a *//
translated: uneven, with trees in the middle, with thickets, very narrow, and very wide.üîΩUneven

original: sa'i char? 'chag cing 'chag pa na /
analyzed: sa'i char? 'chag cing 'chag pa na /
translated: When walking on uneven ground,üîΩblisters form on the feet, the mind does not rest one-pointedly, and the place for work is not accomplished.

original: rkang pa la 'brum bu 'byung ba dang / sems rtse gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / las byed pa'i gnas mi 'grub la; sa yi steng mnyam zhing 'jam par 'chag pa ni bde zhing /
analyzed: rkang pa la 'brum bu 'byung ba dang / sems rtse gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / las byed pa'i gnas mi 'grub la; sa yi steng mnyam zhing 'jam par 'chag pa ni bde zhing /
translated: When walking on even, smooth ground, one is happy,

original: las byed ba'i gnas rdzogs pa de'i phyir tsha ba dang / mi snyoms pa'i sa'i cha ni skyon gcig tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las byed ba'i gnas rdzogs pa de'i phyir tsha ba dang / mi snyoms pa'i sa'i cha ni skyon gcig tu rig par bya'o //
translated: and the place for work is completed. Therefore, hot and uneven ground should be known as one fault.

original: 'chag pa'i bar dang / nang dang / tha mar shing yod pa na bag med par 'ong zhing 'chag pa na dpral ba dang / mgo la gnod pa byed pa ni nang gi shing gi gnod pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'chag pa'i bar dang / nang dang / tha mar shing yod pa na bag med par 'ong zhing 'chag pa na dpral ba dang / mgo la gnod pa byed pa ni nang gi shing gi gnod pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: When walking in the middle and at the end with trees, if one walks carelessly, it causes harm to the forehead and head. This is the second inner harm of trees.

original: rtsva dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa nags tshal thibs po'i 'chag sar byed pa na mun pa nag po'i dus su sbrul la sogs pa'i srog chags rkang pas brdzis na 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: rtsva dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa nags tshal thibs po'i 'chag sar byed pa na mun pa nag po'i dus su sbrul la sogs pa'i srog chags rkang pas brdzis na 'chi ba'am /
translated: When you walk in a place overgrown with grass, vines, and so on, in the dark of night, you might step on a snake or some other animal.

original: des mche bas rmugs nas gnod pa skyel ba ni nags thibs po'i skyon gsum pa'o //
analyzed: des mche bas rmugs nas gnod pa skyel ba ni nags thibs po'i skyon gsum pa'o //
translated: It will bite you in self-defense, and you will suffer. This is the third drawback of dense forests.

original: shin tu dog pa'i 'chag sa'i mchu ru khru gcig pa'am /üîΩkhru phyed pa'i 'chag sa byed pa na nang du gcod pa dang / sen mo'am /
analyzed: shin tu dog pa'i 'chag sa'i mchu ru khru gcig pa'am / khru phyed pa'i 'chag sa byed pa na nang du gcod pa dang / sen mo'am /
translated: When you walk in a place that is too narrow, you might be a cubit or half a cubit from the edge.

original: sor mo 'chad par 'gyur ba ni shin tu dog pa'i skyon bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sor mo 'chad par 'gyur ba ni shin tu dog pa'i skyon bzhi pa'o //
translated: You might hit your head inside or break a fingernail or a toe. This is the fourth drawback of a place that is too narrow.

original: shin tu yangs pa'i 'chag sar 'chag pa na sems g-yeng bar gyur pa dang / sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa mi thob pa ni shin tu yangs pa'i skyon lnga pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yangs pa'i 'chag sar 'chag pa na sems g-yeng bar gyur pa dang / sems rtse gcig tu gnas pa mi thob pa ni shin tu yangs pa'i skyon lnga pa'o //
translated: When you walk in a place that is too open, your mind becomes distracted and you cannot achieve one-pointed concentration. This is the fifth drawback of a place that is too open.

original: 'chag sa'i mtho tshad kyi stugs su khru @280b phyed dang do /
analyzed: 'chag sa'i mtho tshad kyi stugs su khru @280b phyed dang do /
translated: The height of the walking path should be a cubit and four finger breadths.

original: ngos gnyis su khru gcig tsam dkyus su khru drug cu pa sa'i mthil 'jam pa dang mtshungs shing yangs pa bye ma dang bcas pa'i 'chag sa ni rigs so //
analyzed: ngos gnyis su khru gcig tsam dkyus su khru drug cu pa sa'i mthil 'jam pa dang mtshungs shing yangs pa bye ma dang bcas pa'i 'chag sa ni rigs so //
translated: On both sides, one cubit wide, sixty cubits long, smooth like the palm of the hand, spacious, with sand, is the walking place.

original: mchod rten gyi rigs mar me ltar gsal ba gnas brtan chen po dbang chen gyi 'chag sa lta bu bya bar rigs so //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi rigs mar me ltar gsal ba gnas brtan chen po dbang chen gyi 'chag sa lta bu bya bar rigs so //
translated: The type of stupa is like a lamp, the walking place of the great elder Mahendrasena.

original: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de ru 'chag sa byas la skyon lnga po spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ru 'chag sa byas la skyon lnga po spang bar bya'o //
translated: There, having made a walking place, one should abandon the five faults.

original: yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong gi bde ba brgyad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa'i dge sbyong gi bde ba brgyad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Endowed with the eight qualities of a spiritual practitioner, one has the eight joys of a spiritual practitioner.

original: dge sbyong gi bde ba brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi bde ba brgyad dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by endowed with the eight joys of a spiritual practitioner?

original: nor dang / 'bru yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bsod snyoms las 'dod pa med pa dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i 'dod pa med pa dang / nor gces pa'i yul mi sdug par byed pa'am /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'dod pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bsod snyoms las 'dod pa med pa dang / bza' ba dang / bca' ba'i 'dod pa med pa dang / nor gces pa'i yul mi sdug par byed pa'am /
translated: Lack of desire for hoarding wealth and grain, lack of desire for blameless alms, lack of desire for food and drink, lack of desire for the country where one cherishes wealth, or for the country where one is not cherished,

original: mgo re re'i khral la sogs ba len na rgyal po'i rigs kyis yul 'khor gyi mi sdug bsngal ba mi 'dod pa dang / nye bar mkho ba thams cad la 'dod pa med pa dang / chom rkun gyis 'phrog pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: mgo re re'i khral la sogs ba len na rgyal po'i rigs kyis yul 'khor gyi mi sdug bsngal ba mi 'dod pa dang / nye bar mkho ba thams cad la 'dod pa med pa dang / chom rkun gyis 'phrog pa'i 'jigs pa med pa dang /
translated: They will not fear being robbed by thieves,üîΩand they will not be harmed by the king, the king‚Äôs representatives, or the king‚Äôs ministers.

original: rgyal po dang / rgyal tshab dang / blon po chen po'i nye bar 'tshe ba med pa dang / phyogs bzhir 'gro ba na 'tshe ba med pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang / rgyal tshab dang / blon po chen po'i nye bar 'tshe ba med pa dang / phyogs bzhir 'gro ba na 'tshe ba med pa ste /
translated: When they travel in the four directions, they will not be harmed.

original: de ltar der gnas na bde ba brgyad po nyams su myong bar nus so //üîΩde ltar yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa 'dir gnas @281a *//
analyzed: de ltar der gnas na bde ba brgyad po nyams su myong bar nus so // de ltar yon tan brgyad dang ldan pa 'dir gnas @281a *//
translated: If they live in this way, they will be able to experience these eight kinds of happiness.

original: bar byas nas mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bar byas nas mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob par 'gyur zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving lived in this way, endowed with these eight qualities, they will attain the power of the superknowledges.

original: de nas der gnas te /
analyzed: de nas der gnas te /
translated: Then, living there,

original: zad par gyi las rnams byas nas mngon par shes pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zad par gyi las rnams byas nas mngon par shes pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams bskyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: they will perform the deeds of totalities and generate the superknowledges and meditative absorptions.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / lhag mthong brtsams nas gnas thob par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / lhag mthong brtsams nas gnas thob par byed do //
translated: He abides in the attainment of the station by undertaking insight into impermanence, suffering, and no-self.

original: lhag mthong gi stobs blangs nas ji ltar gnas na de'i stobs blang bar nus so //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi stobs blangs nas ji ltar gnas na de'i stobs blang bar nus so //
translated: Having taken up the power of insight, he abides in the way that he is able to take up that power.

original: de ltar der gnas nas de'i mngon par shes pa'i phyir lhag mthong gis stobs mthun par byas pa ni khang pa byas pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar der gnas nas de'i mngon par shes pa'i phyir lhag mthong gis stobs mthun par byas pa ni khang pa byas pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus abiding there, he makes insight conform to the power of the superknowledges for the sake of the house that is built.

original: der skyon dgu dang ldan pa'i gos dor ba ni 'dir sngar rim pa bzhin du brjod pa de rnams de'i tshe khang mig chung ba dang / khang mig che ba dang / 'chag sa la sogs pa so sor brgyan nas me tog dang / 'bras bu dang /üîΩshing ljon pa'i tshogs yid dga' ba dang / bsam pa chu ltar yid du 'ong ba /
analyzed: der skyon dgu dang ldan pa'i gos dor ba ni 'dir sngar rim pa bzhin du brjod pa de rnams de'i tshe khang mig chung ba dang / khang mig che ba dang / 'chag sa la sogs pa so sor brgyan nas me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / shing ljon pa'i tshogs yid dga' ba dang / bsam pa chu ltar yid du 'ong ba /
translated: He casts off the nine faults there, which are mentioned earlier in order, adorning each with a small house, a large house, a walkway, etc.üîΩHe should dwell in a pleasant grove of trees with flowers and fruits,

original: gdug pa can gyi ri dvags med pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i bya'i tshogs med pa shin tu dben par gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: gdug pa can gyi ri dvags med pa dang / gnod par byed pa'i bya'i tshogs med pa shin tu dben par gnas par bya'o //
translated: in a delightful place like a lake, with no wild beasts, no flocks of harmful birds, and in complete solitude.

original: 'chag sa brgyan pa'i phyogs gnyis dang / dbus su rgyab kyi rten gyi gzhi la brten nas bzhugs pa'i ched du 'chag sa'i nang du sa gzhi mnyam pa kha dog ser po rdo @281b dang bsres pa lo ma'i khang pa'i nang du ral pa'i khor yug dang /
analyzed: 'chag sa brgyan pa'i phyogs gnyis dang / dbus su rgyab kyi rten gyi gzhi la brten nas bzhugs pa'i ched du 'chag sa'i nang du sa gzhi mnyam pa kha dog ser po rdo @281b dang bsres pa lo ma'i khang pa'i nang du ral pa'i khor yug dang /
translated: On both sides of the walkway and in the center, there are the bases for the back supports.üîΩIn the middle of the walkway, there is a flat, yellow-colored ground mixed with stones. In the leaf house, there is a circle of hair, a Dharma robe made of pieces of tree bark, a triple stick, a water pot, and so forth, which are the articles of an ascetic.

original: shing shun gyi dum bu'i chos gos dang / dbyu gu gsum dang / bum pa la sogs pa dka' thub pa'i yo byad dang ldan pa bsti gnas kyi nang du chu dang / bum pa chen por chu dang / dung chos kyi chu dang / kham phor dang /
analyzed: shing shun gyi dum bu'i chos gos dang / dbyu gu gsum dang / bum pa la sogs pa dka' thub pa'i yo byad dang ldan pa bsti gnas kyi nang du chu dang / bum pa chen por chu dang / dung chos kyi chu dang / kham phor dang /
translated: In the hermitage, there is water, a large water pot, water for ritual purposes in a conch shell, a bowl,

original: me khang dang / snod sol ba can dang / shing la sogs pa de ltar gang dang / gang du rab tu 'byung ba la rigs so //
analyzed: me khang dang / snod sol ba can dang / shing la sogs pa de ltar gang dang / gang du rab tu 'byung ba la rigs so //
translated: a fire house, a pot with a lid, and wood and so forth. Thus, it is appropriate to go forth in any place that has these things.

original: de thams cad byas nas lo ma'i khang pa'i logs la gang zhig rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa na 'di'i yo byad rnams blangs nas rab tu 'byung bar gyis shig ces yi ger bris nas /
analyzed: de thams cad byas nas lo ma'i khang pa'i logs la gang zhig rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa na 'di'i yo byad rnams blangs nas rab tu 'byung bar gyis shig ces yi ger bris nas /
translated: Having done all that, he wrote on the wall of the leaf-hut, ‚ÄúWhoever wishes to go forth, having taken his requisites, should go forth.‚Äù

original: las sna tshogs pa'i lha'i bu lha'i 'jig rten du song ngo //
analyzed: las sna tshogs pa'i lha'i bu lha'i 'jig rten du song ngo //
translated: The god of various activities went to the world of the gods.

original: mkhas pa blo gros bzang pos gangs can gyi ri'i 'gram na chu klung rjes su 'brang ba dang / bdag nyid kyi gnas dang mthun pa'i gnas su blta zhing chu klung bzlog pa'i las sna tshogs las sprul zhing brgya byin gyis byin pa'i gnas yid la dga' ba mthong ngo //
analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros bzang pos gangs can gyi ri'i 'gram na chu klung rjes su 'brang ba dang / bdag nyid kyi gnas dang mthun pa'i gnas su blta zhing chu klung bzlog pa'i las sna tshogs las sprul zhing brgya byin gyis byin pa'i gnas yid la dga' ba mthong ngo //
translated: The wise one with good intellect, seeing on the slope of the snowy mountain the river following, and his own abode and a suitable place, emanated various activities of reversing the river, and saw the abode given by Indra, which was pleasing to the mind.

original: 'chag sa'i dkyus kyi phyogs gcig tu 'gro zhing rkang pa'i rjes mi mthong bar rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyis thag ring po'i grong nas bsod snyoms btsal bas par zhing 'ongs nas lo ma'i khang par zhugs nas gnas so snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: 'chag sa'i dkyus kyi phyogs gcig tu 'gro zhing rkang pa'i rjes mi mthong bar rab tu 'byung ba rnams kyis thag ring po'i grong nas bsod snyoms btsal bas par zhing 'ongs nas lo ma'i khang par zhugs nas gnas so snyam du bsams so //
translated: He thought, I will go to one side of the path and wait. I will not see the footprints of those who have gone forth. They will have sought alms in the far-off village. Having returned, thinking 'I will enter the leaf hut,' I will wait.

original: de ma thag tu ma slebs par dus ring por @282a *//üîΩma slebs par so sor shes dgos so //
analyzed: de ma thag tu ma slebs par dus ring por @282a *// ma slebs par so sor shes dgos so //
translated: He thought, I will not wait for a long time, but will wait for a short time.üîΩHe thought, I will wait for a short time, but will not wait for a long time.

original: shing gi khang pa'i khang mig gi sgor zhugs te nang du phyin no //
analyzed: shing gi khang pa'i khang mig gi sgor zhugs te nang du phyin no //
translated: He entered the door of the leaf hut and went inside.

original: de dang / de bltas pas rtsig pa chen po la yi ge bris pa bklags nas 'di rnams thams cad bdag gis yo byad du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang / de bltas pas rtsig pa chen po la yi ge bris pa bklags nas 'di rnams thams cad bdag gis yo byad du brtag par bya'o //
translated: He looked and read the letters written on the great wall, thinking, I will consider all of these as my provisions.

original: de rnams blangs nas rab tu byung ngo zhes bsams so //
analyzed: de rnams blangs nas rab tu byung ngo zhes bsams so //
translated: He thought, Having taken these, I will go forth.

original: bdag nyid kyi stod gos dang / smad gos zung dag dor ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi stod gos dang / smad gos zung dag dor ro //
translated: He took off his upper garment and lower garment.

original: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: der gos dor ro //
analyzed: der gos dor ro //
translated: There he took off his clothes.

original: de ltar bzhugs nas sh'a ri'i bu bdag de'i lo ma'i khang pa dang / skyon dgu dang bcas pa'i gos dor ro //
analyzed: de ltar bzhugs nas sh'a ri'i bu bdag de'i lo ma'i khang pa dang / skyon dgu dang bcas pa'i gos dor ro //
translated: Having thus reflected, ≈öƒÅriputra discarded the leaf hut and the robe with nine flaws.

original: de yang skyon dgu gsal bar mthong ste /
analyzed: de yang skyon dgu gsal bar mthong ste /
translated: He clearly saw the nine flaws:

original: dka' thub ba'i rab tu byung ba rnams la gos skyon dgu dang ldan pa ni rnyed dka' ba'i skyon dang / gzhan 'dod pa skye ba'i skyon dang / longs spyod pa na myur du dri ma dang ldan pa'i skyon dang / dri ma can du gyur na 'khrud pa dang /
analyzed: dka' thub ba'i rab tu byung ba rnams la gos skyon dgu dang ldan pa ni rnyed dka' ba'i skyon dang / gzhan 'dod pa skye ba'i skyon dang / longs spyod pa na myur du dri ma dang ldan pa'i skyon dang / dri ma can du gyur na 'khrud pa dang /
translated: For ascetics who have gone forth, a robe with nine flaws is difficult to obtain, it causes desire for others to arise, when used it quickly becomes soiled, when soiled it must be washed and dyed,

original: tshos bya dgos pa dang / longs spyod pa na 'dral ba'i skyon dang / rnying na 'tshem pa dang / lhan pa 'debs dgos pa dang / slar yang tshol ba na rnyed dka' ba'i skyon dang / dka' thub pa'i rab tu byung ba la mi rigs pa'i skyon dang /
analyzed: tshos bya dgos pa dang / longs spyod pa na 'dral ba'i skyon dang / rnying na 'tshem pa dang / lhan pa 'debs dgos pa dang / slar yang tshol ba na rnyed dka' ba'i skyon dang / dka' thub pa'i rab tu byung ba la mi rigs pa'i skyon dang /
translated: when used it is easily torn, when old it must be sewn and patched, when sought again it is difficult to obtain, it is inappropriate for ascetics who have gone forth,üîΩand it is not suitable for the noble ones.

original: dgra la sogs pas 'phrog par 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / ji ltar yang gos ni dgra la sogs pas mi len pa de'i @282b phyir de bzhin du sbed dgos pa dang / gyon pa na rgyan du 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / khyer nas 'gro ba na lus kyi khur po chen por 'gro ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: dgra la sogs pas 'phrog par 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / ji ltar yang gos ni dgra la sogs pas mi len pa de'i @282b phyir de bzhin du sbed dgos pa dang / gyon pa na rgyan du 'gyur ba'i skyon dang / khyer nas 'gro ba na lus kyi khur po chen por 'gro ba'i skyon no //
translated: The faults of being stolen by enemies and so on, the fault of having to hide it in the same way that clothes are not taken by enemies and so on, the fault of becoming an ornament when worn, and the fault of becoming a great burden for the body when carried.

original: shing shun gyi gos zhes pa ni de'i tshe sh'a ri'i bus bdag 'di'i skyon dgu mthong nas gos dor ro //
analyzed: shing shun gyi gos zhes pa ni de'i tshe sh'a ri'i bus bdag 'di'i skyon dgu mthong nas gos dor ro //
translated: The phrase bark garments means that at that time ≈öƒÅriputra saw nine faults in himself and discarded the garments.

original: shing shun la rtsva mun dza dum bu dum bur byas nas sbyor zhing sgrog pa ni shing shun la smad gos dang / stod gos don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing shun la rtsva mun dza dum bu dum bur byas nas sbyor zhing sgrog pa ni shing shun la smad gos dang / stod gos don du gnyer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase having cut the mu√±ja grass into pieces means that he joined the pieces together and sewed them. The phrase for the sake of lower and upper garments means for the sake of bark garments.

original: yon tan bcu gnyis dang ldan pa zhes pa ni phan yon bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing shun gyi gos kyis /
analyzed: yon tan bcu gnyis dang ldan pa zhes pa ni phan yon bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i shing shun gyi gos kyis /
translated: The phrase endowed with twelve qualities means that the bark garments have twelve benefits.

original: phan yon bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i rin chung ba dang / blta na mdzes pa dang / rung ba dang / 'di rnams ni phan yon gcig dang / rang gi lag gis bya bar nus pa ni gnyis pa dang / longs spyod pa ni dri ma can du gyur kyang myur du bkru bar nus pa ni gsum pa dang /
analyzed: phan yon bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i rin chung ba dang / blta na mdzes pa dang / rung ba dang / 'di rnams ni phan yon gcig dang / rang gi lag gis bya bar nus pa ni gnyis pa dang / longs spyod pa ni dri ma can du gyur kyang myur du bkru bar nus pa ni gsum pa dang /
translated: The twelve benefits are: it is inexpensive, it is beautiful to behold, it is suitable, these are the first benefit; it can be done with one's own hands, the second; it can be quickly washed even if it becomes stained, the third;

original: longs spyod pa na rnyings par gyur kyang brtsem par nus pa ni bzhi pa dang / slar yang tshol ba na bde bar byed nus pa ni lnga pa dang / dka' thub pa'i rab tu 'byung ba la rigs pa ni drug pa dang / chom rkun pa la mi mkho ba ni bdun pa dang /
analyzed: longs spyod pa na rnyings par gyur kyang brtsem par nus pa ni bzhi pa dang / slar yang tshol ba na bde bar byed nus pa ni lnga pa dang / dka' thub pa'i rab tu 'byung ba la rigs pa ni drug pa dang / chom rkun pa la mi mkho ba ni bdun pa dang /
translated: The first benefit is that it is inexpensive, the second is that it is beautiful to behold, the third is that it is suitable, the fourth is that it is possible to make it oneself, the fifth is that it is possible to wash it quickly even if it becomes dirty while using it, the sixth is that it is possible to repair it even if it becomes old while using it, the seventh is that it is possible to use it comfortably when seeking again, the eighth is that it is suitable for the renunciation of ascetics, the ninth is that it is not needed by thieves, the tenth is that it is not needed by those who have gone to the forest, the eleventh is that it is not needed by those who have gone to the charnel ground, and the twelfth is that it is not needed by those who have gone to the village.

original: gyon pa na dka' thub pa'i rgyan? du 'gyur ba ni brgyad pa dang / gyon pa na yang par 'gyur ba ni dgu pa dang / chos gos so so la 'dod pa chung ba ni bcu pa dang / slong ba na chos pa la khan @283a *//
analyzed: gyon pa na dka' thub pa'i rgyan? du 'gyur ba ni brgyad pa dang / gyon pa na yang par 'gyur ba ni dgu pa dang / chos gos so so la 'dod pa chung ba ni bcu pa dang / slong ba na chos pa la khan @283a *//
translated: When wearing them, they become ornaments for an ascetic.üîΩWhen wearing them, they become beautiful.üîΩHaving few desires for each of the Dharma robes.

original: ma tho ba med pa ni bcu gcig pa dang / shing shun gyi gos stor na'ang ltos pa med pa ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma tho ba med pa ni bcu gcig pa dang / shing shun gyi gos stor na'ang ltos pa med pa ni bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: When begging, they are without the stain of being a Dharma practitioner.üîΩEven if the bark garment is lost, they are without concern.

original: skyon brgyad dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i khang pa dor zhes pa ni /
analyzed: skyon brgyad dang ldan pa'i lo ma'i khang pa dor zhes pa ni /
translated: The eight faults of the leaf house are:

original: ji ltar dor /
analyzed: ji ltar dor /
translated: How are they abandoned?

original: de'i gos mchog gnyis kyi rigs su gyur pa aa na'o dza'i me tog gi phreng ba lta bu'i gos dmar po blangs nas smad du gyon te; steng du gzhan yang kha dog ser po'i shing shun gyi gos gyon nas /
analyzed: de'i gos mchog gnyis kyi rigs su gyur pa aa na'o dza'i me tog gi phreng ba lta bu'i gos dmar po blangs nas smad du gyon te; steng du gzhan yang kha dog ser po'i shing shun gyi gos gyon nas /
translated: Taking the two types of supreme garments, the red garment that is like a garland of anam≈çja flowers, and wearing it on the lower body, and also wearing on the upper body another bark garment that is yellow in color,

original: phun n'a ga'i me tog gi stan dang 'dra ba'i rkang pa dang bcas pa'i gzig gi pags pa'i g-yang gzhi gyon te ral pa'i khor yug mgo bo la bcings nas gtsug phud brtan par bya ba'i phyir du mkhregs pa'i spyi khab btsugs so //üîΩmu tig dra ba bzhin du 'then thag byu ru'i kha dog lta bu'i bum pa nang du bcug ste gnas gsum gyi kyog po'i shing de blangs nas khur shing de'i phyogs gcig la bum pa dang / phyogs gnyis la lcags kyu dang / smyug 'khur dang /
analyzed: phun n'a ga'i me tog gi stan dang 'dra ba'i rkang pa dang bcas pa'i gzig gi pags pa'i g-yang gzhi gyon te ral pa'i khor yug mgo bo la bcings nas gtsug phud brtan par bya ba'i phyir du mkhregs pa'i spyi khab btsugs so // mu tig dra ba bzhin du 'then thag byu ru'i kha dog lta bu'i bum pa nang du bcug ste gnas gsum gyi kyog po'i shing de blangs nas khur shing de'i phyogs gcig la bum pa dang / phyogs gnyis la lcags kyu dang / smyug 'khur dang /
translated: He wore a tiger skin with the legs and the head still attached, and a girdle of human bone. He had a topknot of hair on his head, and a hard topknot pin.üîΩHe carried a bamboo pole with a string of pearls hanging from it, and a pot the color of coral. He took the pole on his shoulder, the pot on one side, and on the other side an iron hook, a bamboo basket,

original: dbyug gu gsum pa la sogs pa bzung zhing khyer nas phrag pa'i khur du khyer te lag pa g-yas su 'khar ba bzung nas lo ma'i khang pa nas byung ste khru drug cu pa'i 'chags chen por phan tshun du 'chag par byed cing rang gi cha lugs la
analyzed: dbyug gu gsum pa la sogs pa bzung zhing khyer nas phrag pa'i khur du khyer te lag pa g-yas su 'khar ba bzung nas lo ma'i khang pa nas byung ste khru drug cu pa'i 'chags chen por phan tshun du 'chag par byed cing rang gi cha lugs la
translated: and a three-sectioned staff. He carried it on his shoulder, and with a staff in his right hand he came out of the leaf house and walked back and forth on the sixty-cubit-wide plain.

original: bltas nas / bdag gis 'dod pa yongs su @283b rdzogs par thob bo //
analyzed: bltas nas / bdag gis 'dod pa yongs su @283b rdzogs par thob bo //
translated: Looking at it, he thought, ‚ÄúI have attained the fulfillment of my desires.

original: bdag nyid mdzes par rab tu byung nas sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i skyes bu dpa' bos bsngags pa dang bstod cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid mdzes par rab tu byung nas sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i skyes bu dpa' bos bsngags pa dang bstod cing /
translated: Having gone forth in a beautiful way, I have been praised and extolled by the heroes, the Buddhas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni khyim gyi 'chib ba spangs nas bdag gis nges par byung zhing rab tu byung ba mchog bdag gis thob pas dge sbyong gi chos bdag gis byas so; ;bde ba'i 'bras bu bdag gis thob nas spro ba skyes so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni khyim gyi 'chib ba spangs nas bdag gis nges par byung zhing rab tu byung ba mchog bdag gis thob pas dge sbyong gi chos bdag gis byas so; ;bde ba'i 'bras bu bdag gis thob nas spro ba skyes so //
translated: Having gone forth, I have abandoned the household life and have attained the supreme going forth. I have accomplished the Dharma of the ascetics. I have attained the fruit of happiness and have become joyful.

original: khur dal bus sa la bzhag nas 'chag sa'i dbus su kha dog ser ba'i rdo'i steng du gser gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu bzhugs te /
analyzed: khur dal bus sa la bzhag nas 'chag sa'i dbus su kha dog ser ba'i rdo'i steng du gser gyi gzugs brnyan lta bu bzhugs te /
translated: He placed his burden gently on the ground and sat down in the middle of the walking path on a yellow stone, like a golden image.

original: nyin mo'i cha song nas srod kyi dus su lo ma'i khang pa'i nang du bzhugs nas /
analyzed: nyin mo'i cha song nas srod kyi dus su lo ma'i khang pa'i nang du bzhugs nas /
translated: When the day was over, in the evening, he entered the leaf hut.

original: shing khri legs po'i bzhog gi steng du nyal lo //
analyzed: shing khri legs po'i bzhog gi steng du nyal lo //
translated: He lay down on a well-prepared wooden bed.

original: lus la ser bus gos par byed cing nam gyi cha smad la langs te bdag yod pa'i don la rtog cing bdag gis khyim gyi gnas kyi skyon mthong nas bdud rtsil longs spyod pa dang grags pa mtha' yas pa spangs nas dgon par gnas te nges par 'byung
analyzed: lus la ser bus gos par byed cing nam gyi cha smad la langs te bdag yod pa'i don la rtog cing bdag gis khyim gyi gnas kyi skyon mthong nas bdud rtsil longs spyod pa dang grags pa mtha' yas pa spangs nas dgon par gnas te nges par 'byung
translated: He would rise in the latter part of the night and reflect on the meaning of existence, thinking, ‚ÄúHaving seen the faults of living in a home, I have given up enjoying nectar and limitless fame, and I live in the forest.

original: ba btsal ba'i phyir rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: ba btsal ba'i phyir rab tu byung ngo //
translated: I have gone forth in order to seek definite release.‚Äù

original: de nas bzung nas bag med pa'i spyod pa'i rtog pa dang / rab tu dben pa spangs nas 'gro ba log pa'i sbrang mas zabs de ni bdag gis rab tu dben pa dor bar rigs so //
analyzed: de nas bzung nas bag med pa'i spyod pa'i rtog pa dang / rab tu dben pa spangs nas 'gro ba log pa'i sbrang mas zabs de ni bdag gis rab tu dben pa dor bar rigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that time on, I have given up the thought of engaging in heedless conduct and have abandoned going to places that are not secluded.

original: bdag gis kyang khyim pa'i gnas zang zing dang bcas pa mthong ste phyin nas @284a *//
analyzed: bdag gis kyang khyim pa'i gnas zang zing dang bcas pa mthong ste phyin nas @284a *//
translated: I have seen that the state of a householder is full of impurities.

original: lo ma'i khang pa yid du 'ong ba 'di'ang kha dog ser pos sa gzhi la zhal ba legs par byas nas /
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa yid du 'ong ba 'di'ang kha dog ser pos sa gzhi la zhal ba legs par byas nas /
translated: I have gone to this pleasant hut of leaves, which has a floor well covered with yellow ochre.

original: dngul gyi kha dog ltar dkar ba'i rtsig pa rnams dang / thog phug ron gyi rkang ba'i kha dog ltar dmar ba'i lo ma'i bla khab can no //
analyzed: dngul gyi kha dog ltar dkar ba'i rtsig pa rnams dang / thog phug ron gyi rkang ba'i kha dog ltar dmar ba'i lo ma'i bla khab can no //
translated: The walls are white like silver, and the roofs are covered with leaves red like the feet of a pigeon.

original: sna tshogs pa'i kha dog can gyi shing khri'i stan la nyal ba dang / 'dug pa na bde bar lta ba de rnams ni ches cher lhag par khyim pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i kha dog can gyi shing khri'i stan la nyal ba dang / 'dug pa na bde bar lta ba de rnams ni ches cher lhag par khyim pa'i phun sum tshogs pa dang 'dra bar mthong ngo //
translated: They see that it is very much like the excellence of a householder, lying down and sitting on a bed of various colors.

original: lo ma'i khang pa'i skyon bltas pas skyon brgyad mthong ste /
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa'i skyon bltas pas skyon brgyad mthong ste /
translated: Having looked at the faults of the leaf house, he sees eight faults.

original: lo ma'i khang pa la longs spyod pan skyon brgyad po ni /
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa la longs spyod pan skyon brgyad po ni /
translated: The eight faults of enjoying the leaf house are:üîΩThe first fault is that in order to enjoy the leaf house, one needs much wealth for many trees, and one must gather and make a house.

original: shing mang po la nor mang po dgos pa dang bsdus nas khang pa byed cing tshol ba ni skyon gcig pa dang / rtsva dang / sa 'dzad pa dang / yang dang / yang zad pas na bcos dgos pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ni skyon gnyis pa dang /
analyzed: shing mang po la nor mang po dgos pa dang bsdus nas khang pa byed cing tshol ba ni skyon gcig pa dang / rtsva dang / sa 'dzad pa dang / yang dang / yang zad pas na bcos dgos pa rgyun mi 'chad pa ni skyon gnyis pa dang /
translated: The second fault is that since the grass and earth are exhausted again and again, one must constantly repair it.

original: nyal ba'i gnas zhes bya ba na chen po la rigs te /
analyzed: nyal ba'i gnas zhes bya ba na chen po la rigs te /
translated: The third fault is that since the leaf house is a place for lying down, it is a place for the great ones.

original: dus ma yin par slong dgos pas sems gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / 'gro dgos pa ni skyon gsum pa dang / drang ba dang / dro ba dang / 'jam pa dang / lus bde bar byed pa ni skyon bzhi pa dang / khang ba'i nang du zhugs nas sdig pa byed par nus pa dang /
analyzed: dus ma yin par slong dgos pas sems gcig tu mi gnas pa dang / 'gro dgos pa ni skyon gsum pa dang / drang ba dang / dro ba dang / 'jam pa dang / lus bde bar byed pa ni skyon bzhi pa dang / khang ba'i nang du zhugs nas sdig pa byed par nus pa dang /
translated: The fifth fault is that one is able to commit evil deeds while staying inside the house.üîΩThe sixth fault is that one protects it, thinking It is mine.üîΩThe seventh fault is that there are two, There are householders.

original: ngo tsha ba bzlog pa ni skyon lnga pa dang / bdag gi yin no zhes srung ba ni skyon drug pa dang / @284b dang / khyim pa yod ces pa gnyis par skyon bdun pa dang / shig dang / 'dre shig dang / khyi shig la sogs pa'i srog chags du ma gnas par 'gyur ba ni skyon brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha ba bzlog pa ni skyon lnga pa dang / bdag gi yin no zhes srung ba ni skyon drug pa dang / @284b dang / khyim pa yod ces pa gnyis par skyon bdun pa dang / shig dang / 'dre shig dang / khyi shig la sogs pa'i srog chags du ma gnas par 'gyur ba ni skyon brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth fault is that many creatures such as lice, fleas, and dogs will live there.

original: 'di rnams kyi skyon brgyad po rnams mthong nas sems dpa' chen pos lo ma'i khang pa spangs so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi skyon brgyad po rnams mthong nas sems dpa' chen pos lo ma'i khang pa spangs so //
translated: Seeing these eight faults, the great being abandoned the leaf house.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩskyon brgyad dang ni ldan pa yi //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / skyon brgyad dang ni ldan pa yi //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: lo ma'i khang pa spangs zhes pa //
analyzed: lo ma'i khang pa spangs zhes pa //
translated: The leaf house with eight faults is abandoned.

original: shing gi drung du gnas gyur na //
analyzed: shing gi drung du gnas gyur na //
translated: If you live at the foot of a tree,

original: yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yin //
translated: you will have ten virtues.üîΩYou will have abandoned concealed places

original: yib ba'i gnas rnams spangs pa dang // yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yi //
analyzed: yib ba'i gnas rnams spangs pa dang // yon tan bcu dang ldan pa yi //
translated: and will have the ten virtues

original: shing gi drung du gnas pa'o //üîΩzhes brjod pa ni de la yon tan bcu po 'di bsag mi dgos pa ni yon tan gcig dang / nyal bar gnas pa tsam gyis bsrung mi dgos par rnyed pa ni gnyis pa dang / der byi dor byed pa med par longs spyod pa dang /
analyzed: shing gi drung du gnas pa'o // zhes brjod pa ni de la yon tan bcu po 'di bsag mi dgos pa ni yon tan gcig dang / nyal bar gnas pa tsam gyis bsrung mi dgos par rnyed pa ni gnyis pa dang / der byi dor byed pa med par longs spyod pa dang /
translated: of living at the foot of a tree.üîΩThe ten virtues are as follows: The first is that you do not need to collect things. The second is that you do not need to guard what you have found, since you just lie down wherever you are. The third is that you enjoy the place without having to clean it up, and you live happily.

original: bde bar gnas pa dang / slong ba med pa ni gsum pa dang / ngo tsha ba ni yib pa med cing der sdig pa byed pa med la sbed pa med pa ni bzhi pa dang / bla khab med pa'i gnas bzhin du lus rtag tu sdod pa med pa ni lnga pa dang /
analyzed: bde bar gnas pa dang / slong ba med pa ni gsum pa dang / ngo tsha ba ni yib pa med cing der sdig pa byed pa med la sbed pa med pa ni bzhi pa dang / bla khab med pa'i gnas bzhin du lus rtag tu sdod pa med pa ni lnga pa dang /
translated: The fourth is that you are not ashamed, since there is no concealment, and you do not commit sins there and hide them. The fifth is that your body is never still, as if you were in a place without a roof.

original: yongs su 'dzin par mi 'dod pa ni drug pa dang / khyim gyi? 'dod pa spangs pa ni bdun pa dang / mang po dogs pa'i 'dzin pa med pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba med pa dang / 'gro ba na 'dod pa med pa ni brgyad pa dang /üîΩsdod pa @285a *//
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par mi 'dod pa ni drug pa dang / khyim gyi? 'dod pa spangs pa ni bdun pa dang / mang po dogs pa'i 'dzin pa med pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba med pa dang / 'gro ba na 'dod pa med pa ni brgyad pa dang / sdod pa @285a *//
translated: Not having the grasping of fear of crowds, not having to protect anything, and not wanting to go are the eighth.üîΩNot having pleasure in staying is the ninth.

original: na dga' ba dang bcas pa med pa ni dgu ba dang / shing drung gi gnas ni song zhing song ba na rnyed sla ba dang / ltos pa med pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: na dga' ba dang bcas pa med pa ni dgu ba dang / shing drung gi gnas ni song zhing song ba na rnyed sla ba dang / ltos pa med pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The abode of the foot of a tree is easy to find when one has gone and gone, and is independent, the tenth.

original: yon tan bcu po 'di mthong ste /
analyzed: yon tan bcu po 'di mthong ste /
translated: Seeing these ten qualities,üîΩit is said that one should stay at the foot of a tree.

original: shing gi 'gram du gnas zhes brjod pa dang / 'di lta bu de rnams ni byed par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi 'gram du gnas zhes brjod pa dang / 'di lta bu de rnams ni byed par bsams pa'o //
translated: These are the thoughts of the one who does it.

original: sems dpa' chen po sang gi nyi ma la bsod snyoms la gshegs pas de ma thag tu grong du sleb ste mi rnams spro ba chen po skyes nas bsod snyoms byin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po sang gi nyi ma la bsod snyoms la gshegs pas de ma thag tu grong du sleb ste mi rnams spro ba chen po skyes nas bsod snyoms byin no //
translated: The great being went for alms on the following day. As soon as he arrived in the village, the people were very happy and gave him alms.

original: de'i gdugs tshod thon nas gnas su byon te sleb cing bzhugs nas bsams pa /
analyzed: de'i gdugs tshod thon nas gnas su byon te sleb cing bzhugs nas bsams pa /
translated: When the time for his meal arrived, he went to his dwelling place, and after arriving and sitting down, he thought:

original: bdag gis bsod snyoms thob pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis bsod snyoms thob pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúI did not go forth in order to obtain alms.

original: zas zhim po zhes bya ba 'dis nga rgyal gyis rgyags pa dang / skyes bu 'dod pa'i rgyags pa 'phel ba dang / bza' ba'i gzhi la brten nas sdug bsngal mtha' med do //
analyzed: zas zhim po zhes bya ba 'dis nga rgyal gyis rgyags pa dang / skyes bu 'dod pa'i rgyags pa 'phel ba dang / bza' ba'i gzhi la brten nas sdug bsngal mtha' med do //
translated: This ‚Äòdelicious food‚Äô causes the intoxication of pride, the intoxication of desire for a man, and suffering without end based on the basis of eating.

original: bdag gis slar yang btab pa dang bskrun pa las skyes pa'i 'bru'i bza' ba spangs nas /
analyzed: bdag gis slar yang btab pa dang bskrun pa las skyes pa'i 'bru'i bza' ba spangs nas /
translated: I will give up the food of grain that is planted and grown again,

analyzed: 'bras bu mchog gi bza' ba la brten par bya'o //
translated: and rely on the food of the supreme fruit.‚Äù

original: des de nas de blangs te /
analyzed: des de nas de blangs te /

analyzed: de ltar byas nas lus sdug bsngal du 'bad pa byas pa dang / zhag bdun gyi nang du snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad po rnams dang / mngon par shes pa lnga skyes te /
translated: after doing that, he made an effort to suffer in his body, and within seven days, the eight meditative absorptions and the five superknowledges arose.

original: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

analyzed: lhag ma med par spangs pa dang // yon tan du ma dang ldan pa'i //
translated: And the complete abandonment of the remainder,

original: 'bras bu sogs la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu sogs la 'jug pa'o //
translated: And the attainment of the fruit endowed with many qualities.üîΩIn that place, in the hermitage,

analyzed: der ni dka' thub kyi gnas dang // sdod dang 'chag pa'i gnas rnams su //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i stobs thob bo //
translated: He attained the power of the higher perceptions.

original: de ltar mngon par shes pa thob nas /
analyzed: de ltar mngon par shes pa thob nas /
translated: Having attained the higher perceptions in this way,

analyzed: blo gros bzang lo dka' thub pas bde ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas so //
translated: The one of good intellect, the ascetic, remained in the bliss of meditative concentration.

analyzed: de'i tshe mar me mdzad ces bya ba'i ston pa 'jig rten du byon par gyur to //
translated: At that time, a teacher named Dƒ´pa·πÉkara appeared in the world.

analyzed: de mngal du zhugs nas bltams pa dang / byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na /

analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams stong phrag bcu po thams cad g-yos so //

analyzed: rab tu g-yos so // sgra sgrogs so //

analyzed: sgra cher sgrogs so //

original: sngon gyi mtshan mar byur pa sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / blo gros bzang po dka' thub pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la gnas pas de rnams kyi sgra ma thos pa dang / de rnams kyi sngon gyi mtshan ma ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshan mar byur pa sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / blo gros bzang po dka' thub pas snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la gnas pas de rnams kyi sgra ma thos pa dang / de rnams kyi sngon gyi mtshan ma ma mthong ngo //
translated: The thirty-two signs of the past were not heard by the ascetic Subhadra, who was absorbed in the bliss of meditation, nor were they seen by him.

original: ci'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Why is it said?

analyzed: stan gcig la ni rten nas su //

analyzed: bdag gis de ltar grub pa thob //
translated: I attained such an accomplishment.

original: rgyal ba mar me mdzad ces pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba mar me mdzad ces pa //
translated: The Victorious One named Dipankara

analyzed: 'jig rten 'dren pa byon par gyur //
translated: appeared as a guide in the world.

analyzed: mtshan ma bzhi po mthong ma gyur //

original: bsam gtan bde bsam thos so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bde bsam thos so //

original: de'i tshe stobs bcu @286a *//
analyzed: de'i tshe stobs bcu @286a *//
translated: At that time, the ten powers

translated: The Buddha Dipankara, together with an assembly of four hundred thousand who had exhausted their defilements, walked for the sake of benefiting sentient beings and arrived at the city called Kusumatalaprabha.

analyzed: de ltar rim gyis sems can la phan pa'i don du 'chag cing dga' ba can gyi grong khyer du byon te /

translated: The people who lived there heard that he was staying in the beautiful great temple. They brought with them fresh butter, clarified butter, and so forth, as well as medicine, clothing, bedding, and so forth, and garlands of perfume.

analyzed: phyag byas nas dri la sogs pa'i mchod pa byas te /

analyzed: grong khyer brgyan /

analyzed: chu shing gi shing dang / bum pa gang ba rnams sgrigs nas bzhag par byas so //

analyzed: de'i tshe blo gros bzang po dka' thub pas rang gi gnas nas steng du 'phags te mi de rnams kyi steng gi cha'i mkha' la 'gro ba de la mi rnams dga' zhing tshim pas mthing ste nam mkha' nas sa la phyogs gcig tu 'khod pa la mi rnams
translated: At that time, the ascetic Sumati rose up from his abode and went through the sky above those people. The people were delighted and satisfied, and from the sky they gathered in one place on the ground.

original: kyis bris so //
analyzed: kyis bris so //

analyzed: bsod nams dang ldan pa rnams lam 'di rnams su zhig gis brkyen par byas /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: yul dang phyogs kyi mthar gnas pa'i // de bzhin gshegs pa mgron du gnyer //

analyzed: bdag ni de tshe de yi dus //

analyzed: stobs bcu dang ldan pa'i mar me mdzad kyis yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thob nas /
translated: that Dƒ´pa·πÉkara, who possesses the ten powers, has attained perfect buddhahood

analyzed: khyim pa'i mtshan ma dang ldan pas ni ma yin no //

analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no // de la 'dir 'dun pa chen po'i dpe ni gal te 'di ltar gang zhig 'jig rten thams cad kyi khor yug gi nang chu yis gang bar gyur pa la bdag gis lag pas brkyal te pha rol tu 'gro bar nus na des sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro

original: // yang na gang du gang zhig slar yang thams cad kyi khor yug gi nang du 'o ma mang pos bkang ste rkang pas nyen cing rdul du byed pas pha rol tu 'gro bar nus na de yis sangs rgyas thob par nus so //

analyzed: btson ra bzhin du lta bar gyis // nges par 'byung ba sngon du ni //

analyzed: skye ba las ni grol bar 'gyur //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: lhag par tshol ba na bzhi ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas 'di lta bu'i sems su gyur to // mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang @299a *//
translated: When he was searching further, he saw the fourth perfection, that of wisdom, and his mind became like this:

original: rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO wise one, O one with good intellect, O ascetic, from now on you should also complete the perfection of wisdom.

original: dman pa dang / 'bring po dang / chen po rnams su mi sems par de rnams kyi gnas su song ste mkhas pa rnams la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa dang / 'bring po dang / chen po rnams su mi sems par de rnams kyi gnas su song ste mkhas pa rnams la dri bar bya'o //
translated: Without thinking in terms of inferior, middling, and superior, you should go to the places where the wise are and ask them.

original: ji ltar na bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i dge slong dman pa la sogs pa'i gnas su song ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i dge slong dman pa la sogs pa'i gnas su song ste /

analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba ma spangs par go rim bzhin du bsod snyoms la 'gro ba myur du rang gi bza' ba'i tshad thob par 'gyur ro //

original: de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang mkhas pa thams cad kyi drung du song ste dri bar byas nas sangs rgyas thob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod kyis kyang mkhas pa thams cad kyi drung du song ste dri bar byas nas sangs rgyas thob bo //
translated: In the same way, you too should go to the wise and ask them, and attain Buddhahood.

original: bzhi pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsten par bya ste gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: bzhi pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bsten par bya ste gnas par gyis shig /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /

original: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //
analyzed: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //

original: bzhi pa shes rab pha rol phyin //
analyzed: bzhi pa shes rab pha rol phyin //

original: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //

analyzed: re zhig bzhi pa 'di yis ni //

translated: in the same way, you should alwaysüîΩconsult with the wise.

analyzed: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos ni 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: lhag par btsal na lnga pa brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob nas 'di lta bu'i sems su gyur to //

analyzed: zhum pa med pa'i brtson 'grus byas na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur /

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /

original: gang zhig chos ni thob byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig chos ni thob byed pa //

analyzed: sngon gyi skyes bu ? po yi // bsnyen dang bsten par byas pas so // re zhig lnga po 'di yis ni //

analyzed: gal te byang chub mchog 'dod na //

original: brtson 'grus pha rol phyin par gyis //
analyzed: brtson 'grus pha rol phyin par gyis //

analyzed: brtan por byas te @300a *//

analyzed: yid ni rtag tu brtan pa yin //

analyzed: byang chub thob par 'gyur ba yin //

analyzed: lhag par tshol ba na drug pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas 'di lta bu'i sems su gyur to //
translated: In particular, when seeking, having seen the sixth perfection of patience, he had a thought like this:

original: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //

analyzed: bzang po dang / ngan par byas pa la bzod par bya'o //

original: ji ltar sa'i steng du gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba gos par byas nas gzhi khro bar mi byed pa bzhin du bzod cing sran pa dang / lhag par gnas pa de bzhin du'o //

translated: Just as the earth is not irritated when defiled by clean and unclean things, you should be patient and endure, and remain especially firm.

original: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang gnod pa dang / phan par byas kyang bzod cing sran par byas na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang gnod pa dang / phan par byas kyang bzod cing sran par byas na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: drug pa bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas nas gnas par gyis shig /

analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //

analyzed: gtsang dang mi gtsang byugs pa na //

analyzed: byang chub yang dag thob par 'gyur //

analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //

analyzed: lhag par tshol ba na bdun pa bden pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas 'di lta bu'i sems su gyur to //

analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas bden pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rdzogs par bya'o //

original: de yi tshen tshol ba mthong //

analyzed: bdun pa bden pa'i pha rol phyin //

analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par gyis //

analyzed: byang chub yang dag thob par 'gyur //

original: rang gi gnas shig tu gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi gnas shig tu gnas so //
translated: it remains in its own place.

original: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang bdag nyid lhag par gnas pa rnams mi g-yo bar gyur na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang bdag nyid lhag par gnas pa rnams mi g-yo bar gyur na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, you should also be steadfast in yourself. When you become unshakable, you will attain buddhahood.‚Äù

original: brgyad pa lhag par gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas nas gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: brgyad pa lhag par gnas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas nas gnas par gyis shig /
translated: Having made firm the perfection of the superior abiding, you should abide.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩNot only this,

original: 'di tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'di tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //
translated: but also

original: gang zhig byang chub thob 'dod chos //
analyzed: gang zhig byang chub thob 'dod chos //
translated: one who wishes to attain enlightenment should seek

analyzed: gzhan pa yang ni btsal bar bya // gang zhig chos 'di thob byed pa //
translated: the other qualities.üîΩAt that time, one who is seeking

original: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //
analyzed: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //
translated: will see the attainment of this quality.

original: brgyad pa lhag gnas pha rol phyin //
analyzed: brgyad pa lhag gnas pha rol phyin //
translated: The perfection of the superior abiding

original: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
translated: is sought by the great beings of the past

original: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pas so //üîΩre zhig brgyad pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pas so // re zhig brgyad pa 'di yis ni //
translated: through service and reliance.üîΩFor the time being,

original: brtan par bya ste gnas par gyis //
analyzed: brtan par bya ste gnas par gyis //
translated: you should abide by this eighth one, making it firm.

original: de la khyod ni g-yo med pas //
analyzed: de la khyod ni g-yo med pas //
translated: Since you are without deceit

original: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: you will attain true enlightenment.

original: ji ltar ri bo'i brag chen po //
analyzed: ji ltar ri bo'i brag chen po //
translated: Just as a great rock of the mountain

original: g-yo ba med cing legs par gnas //
analyzed: g-yo ba med cing legs par gnas //
translated: is immovable and well-established,

original: rlung chen pos ni g-yo ba med //
analyzed: rlung chen pos ni g-yo ba med //
translated: not moved by a great wind

original: rang gi gnas su gnas pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su gnas pa nyid //
translated: but remains in its own place,

original: de bzhin khyod kyi @302a *//üîΩlhag gnas par //
analyzed: de bzhin khyod kyi @302a *//üîΩlhag gnas par //
translated: so also your superior abiding

original: thams cad du ni mi g-yo bar //
analyzed: thams cad du ni mi g-yo bar //
translated: In all circumstances, without wavering,

original: lhag gnas pha rol phyin gyur pas //
analyzed: lhag gnas pha rol phyin gyur pas //
translated: through the perfection of steadfastness,

original: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: one will attain perfect awakening.

original: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, one should view this as not only the quality that leads to buddhahood.

original: lhag par tshol ba na dgu pa byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthong bas de lta bu'i khams su gyur to //
analyzed: lhag par tshol ba na dgu pa byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mthong bas de lta bu'i khams su gyur to //
translated: When searching further, in the ninth chapter, he saw the perfection of love. Thus, his element became like that.

original: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: You, the wise one with excellent intelligence, from now on, you should also complete the perfection of love.

original: phan pa dang / mi phan par gyur kyang sems gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa dang / mi phan par gyur kyang sems gcig tu bya'o //
translated: Even if there is benefit or harm, one should have a single thought.

original: ji ltar chu ni sdig pa can gyi skye bo dang / dge ba'i skye bos kyang bsil bar gyur cing gcig tu mtshungs par byas nas reg go /
analyzed: ji ltar chu ni sdig pa can gyi skye bo dang / dge ba'i skye bos kyang bsil bar gyur cing gcig tu mtshungs par byas nas reg go /
translated: Just as water is cool, whether it is used by sinful people or by virtuous people, it is used equally and in the same way.

original: de ltar na 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems gcig tu gyur nas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang sems can thams cad la byams pa'i sems gcig tu gyur nas sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, you too, having become one with the loving mind toward all sentient beings, will attain Buddhahood.

original: dgu ba byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas te gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: dgu ba byams pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas te gnas par gyis shig /
translated: Thus, having stabilized the perfection of love, you should abide.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi //üîΩgang zhig byang chub 'dod chos //
analyzed: 'di tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi // gang zhig byang chub 'dod chos //
translated: Not only this much,üîΩBut also one who desires enlightenment

original: gzhan pa yang ni btsal bar bya //
analyzed: gzhan pa yang ni btsal bar bya //
translated: Should seek the Dharma.üîΩAt the time of seeking that

original: gang zhig chos 'di thob byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig chos 'di thob byed pa //
translated: Which causes one to attain this Dharma,

original: de yi tshen tshol ba mthong //
analyzed: de yi tshen tshol ba mthong //
translated: One sees the seeker.

original: dgu pa byams pa'i pha rol phyin //üîΩsngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
analyzed: dgu pa byams pa'i pha rol phyin // sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
translated: The ninth is the perfection of love,üîΩWhich was practiced and relied upon

original: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pa'o //
translated: By the great beings of the past.

original: re zhig dgu pa 'di @302b yis ni //
analyzed: re zhig dgu pa 'di @302b yis ni //
translated: For the time being, by this ninth,

original: byams par byas te gnas par gyis //
analyzed: byams par byas te gnas par gyis //
translated: Having become loving, you should abide.

original: gal te byang chub thob 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te byang chub thob 'dod na //
translated: If you desire to attain enlightenment,

original: byams pa mtshungs pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: byams pa mtshungs pa med par 'gyur //
translated: You will become incomparable in love.

original: ji ltar chu zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: ji ltar chu zhes bya ba la //
translated: Just as in the case of water,

original: dge 'am sdig pa'i skye po ni //
analyzed: dge 'am sdig pa'i skye po ni //
translated: Whether a person is virtuous or sinful,

original: mtshungs par bsil bar gyur la reg /
analyzed: mtshungs par bsil bar gyur la reg /
translated: And likewise, when you touch the cool,

original: rdul dang drim spong bar byed //
analyzed: rdul dang drim spong bar byed //
translated: You will abandon dust and dirt.üîΩThus, you should have the same love

original: de ltar khyod kyis mi phan dang // ban la'ang mtshungs par byams par bya //
analyzed: de ltar khyod kyis mi phan dang // ban la'ang mtshungs par byams par bya //
translated: For those who are not helpful and those who are.

original: byams pa'i pha rol phyin gyur nas //
analyzed: byams pa'i pha rol phyin gyur nas //
translated: Having perfected love,

original: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: You will attain perfect awakening.

original: gzhan yang sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos 'di 'ba' zhig ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, you should see that this is not the only factor that leads to buddhahood.

original: lhag par tshol ba na bcu la btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas 'di lta bu yi sems su gyur to //
analyzed: lhag par tshol ba na bcu la btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mthong nas 'di lta bu yi sems su gyur to //
translated: When he was seeking the perfection of equanimity, he saw ten people who had died. He thought,

original: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa blo gros bzang po dka' thub pa khyod kyis 'di nas bzung nas btang snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúO wise one, O one with excellent intelligence, O ascetic, from now on you should also complete the perfection of equanimity.

original: bde ba'am / sdug bsngal yang bar ma la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'am / sdug bsngal yang bar ma la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Whether you experience pleasure or pain, remain neutral.

original: ji ltar sa gzhi la gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang bas byugs kyang bar mar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sa gzhi la gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang bas byugs kyang bar mar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the earth remains neutral whether anointed with pure or impure substances,

original: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bar mar gnas par gyur na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ltar khyod kyis kyang bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la bar mar gnas par gyur na sangs rgyas thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, you too, by remaining impartial toward happiness and suffering, will attain buddhahood.

original: bcu pa ? snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas la gnas par gyis shig /
analyzed: bcu pa ? snyoms kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brtan par byas la gnas par gyis shig /
translated: Make firm the perfection of equanimity and abide in it.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩNot only this,

analyzed: 'di tsam 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi // gang zhig byang chub thob 'dod @303a *//
translated: but alsoüîΩseek out
