analyzed: chos // gzhan pa yang ni btsal bar gyis //
translated: the other qualities

original: gang zhig chos ni thob byed pa //
analyzed: gang zhig chos ni thob byed pa //
translated: that lead to the attainment of awakening.

original: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //
analyzed: de yi tshe na tshol ba mthong //
translated: At that time, you will seeüîΩthe one who attains the qualities.üîΩThe perfection of equanimity,

original: bcu pa btang snyoms pha rol phyin //
analyzed: bcu pa btang snyoms pha rol phyin //
translated: the tenth,üîΩis sought out

original: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
analyzed: sngon gyi skyes bu chen po yis //
translated: by the great beings of the past.

original: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pas so //üîΩre zhig bcu pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: bsnyen dang bsten par byas pas so // re zhig bcu pa 'di yis ni //
translated: Having made it firm,

original: brtan par byas nas gnas par gyis //
analyzed: brtan par byas nas gnas par gyis //
translated: abide in it for a while.

original: srang ni gang bar 'gyur ba bzhin //
analyzed: srang ni gang bar 'gyur ba bzhin //
translated: Like a scale being balanced,

original: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: you will attain perfect awakening.

original: ji ltar sa gzhi zhes bya la //
analyzed: ji ltar sa gzhi zhes bya la //
translated: Just as the earth is called

original: gtsang dang mi gtsang byugs pa na //
analyzed: gtsang dang mi gtsang byugs pa na //
translated: When smeared with clean or unclean substances,

original: ltos pa med cing btang snyoms pas //
analyzed: ltos pa med cing btang snyoms pas //
translated: without regard, indifferent,

original: khro ba med par spong ba yin //üîΩji ltar khyod kyis kyang bde sdug /
analyzed: khro ba med par spong ba yin // ji ltar khyod kyis kyang bde sdug /
translated: without anger, you are purified.üîΩJust as you, in all situations,

original: dus rnams kun tu srang bzhin du //
analyzed: dus rnams kun tu srang bzhin du //
translated: weigh pleasure and pain,

original: btang snyoms pha rol phyin gyur nas //
analyzed: btang snyoms pha rol phyin gyur nas //
translated: having become the perfection of equanimity,

original: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: yang dag byang chub thob par 'gyur //
translated: you will attain perfect awakening.

original: de nas bsams pa /
analyzed: de nas bsams pa /
translated: Then he thought,

original: 'jig rten pa 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub rdzogs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de rnams nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa 'di rnams byang chub sems dpa' la byang chub rdzogs par byed pa dang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos de rnams nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThese worldly people have the very qualities that cause the bodhisattva to perfect awakening and become a buddha.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dor na gzhan med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dor na gzhan med do //
translated: If one abandons the ten perfections, there is nothing else.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po 'di ni steng gi nam mkha' na'ang med do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po 'di ni steng gi nam mkha' na'ang med do //
translated: These ten perfections do not exist in the sky above,

original: 'og gi sa gzhi la'ang med do //
analyzed: 'og gi sa gzhi la'ang med do //
translated: nor do they exist on the ground below,

original: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams na'ang med do //
analyzed: shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams na'ang med do //
translated: nor do they exist in the directions such as east, etc.

original: bdag nyid kho na'i snying gi sha'i nang na gnas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho na'i snying gi sha'i nang na gnas so //
translated: They exist only in the heart flesh of oneself.‚Äù

original: de ltar de yi snying la so so gnas pa mthong nas thams cad brtan par @303b bya ste gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de yi snying la so so gnas pa mthong nas thams cad brtan par @303b bya ste gnas par bya'o //
translated: Having seen that it is present in his heart in this way, he should stabilize and settle everything.

original: yang dang / yang du dran par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dang / yang du dran par bya ste /
translated: He should remember again and again.

original: lugs las byung ba dang / lugs las zlog pa brtan par bya'o //üîΩtham nas bzung ste thog ma'i bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: lugs las byung ba dang / lugs las zlog pa brtan par bya'o // tham nas bzung ste thog ma'i bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: He should stabilize the forward and reverse orders.üîΩHe should contemplate from the end to the beginning.

original: dang po nas bzung nas tha ma'i bar bsam mo //üîΩdbus nas bzung nas thog ma nas tha ma'i bar bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po nas bzung nas tha ma'i bar bsam mo // dbus nas bzung nas thog ma nas tha ma'i bar bsam par bya'o //
translated: He should contemplate from the beginning to the end.üîΩHe should contemplate from the middle to the beginning and end.

original: thog ma dang / tham nas bzung nas dbus kyi bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang / tham nas bzung nas dbus kyi bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: He should contemplate from the beginning and end to the middle.

original: lus yongs su gtong ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus yongs su gtong ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The giving of the body is called the perfection.

original: phyi'i longs spyod yongs su gtong ba ni nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi'i longs spyod yongs su gtong ba ni nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The giving of external enjoyments is called the proximate perfection.

original: srog yongs su gtong ba ni don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog yongs su gtong ba ni don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The giving of life is called the ultimate perfection.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu pa dang / don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po dang / nye ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu pa dang / don dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu po'o //
translated: the ten perfections, the ten proximate perfections, and the ten ultimate perfections.

original: me yi steng du 'bru mar bskol ba bzhin du khor yug gi nang du rgya mtsho chen po ri bo mchog rab kyis bsgrub pa bzhin du dran par bya ste /
analyzed: me yi steng du 'bru mar bskol ba bzhin du khor yug gi nang du rgya mtsho chen po ri bo mchog rab kyis bsgrub pa bzhin du dran par bya ste /
translated: Like oil is pressed from seeds on a millstone, the great ocean is pressed between the mountains Supreme and Great Supreme.

original: de yi pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dran par byas nas chos kyi gzis 'bum phrag gnyis dang / stong phrag bzhi bcu lhag pa'i sa chen po 'di yi stugs la glang po che'i rkang pas gnon cing smyug ma 'chag pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de yi pha rol tu phyin pa bcu dran par byas nas chos kyi gzis 'bum phrag gnyis dang / stong phrag bzhi bcu lhag pa'i sa chen po 'di yi stugs la glang po che'i rkang pas gnon cing smyug ma 'chag pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Having remembered the ten perfections, with the tusk of the Dharma he presses down on the great earth with two hundred and forty thousand leagues, like pressing sugarcane.

original: bur shing gi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du btsir ba dang / sgra chen po sgrogs pa bzhin du yang dag par sgrogs so //
analyzed: bur shing gi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du btsir ba dang / sgra chen po sgrogs pa bzhin du yang dag par sgrogs so //
translated: He is pressed like a sugarcane press, and he proclaims with a great sound.

original: rab tu g-yos so //üîΩyang dag @304a *//
analyzed: rab tu g-yos so // yang dag @304a *//
translated: He shakes.

original: par rab tu g-yos te /
analyzed: par rab tu g-yos te /
translated: He shakes perfectly.

original: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin no //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi 'khor lo bzhin no //
translated: He shakes perfectly, like a potter's wheel.

original: 'bru mar gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du yongs su bskor ro //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi 'khrul 'khor bzhin du yongs su bskor ro //
translated: It was turned like an oil-mill.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'di yi 'jig rten de rnams nyid //
analyzed: 'di yi 'jig rten de rnams nyid //
translated: The world of this one is just these.

original: gang zhig byang chub thob byed chos //
analyzed: gang zhig byang chub thob byed chos //
translated: The Dharma that causes the attainment of enlightenment,

original: 'di ni steng dang gzhan na'ang med //
analyzed: 'di ni steng dang gzhan na'ang med //
translated: This is not above or elsewhere.

original: brtan par bya ste sems la zhog /üîΩrang bzhin gyis ni g-yo med par //
analyzed: brtan par bya ste sems la zhog / rang bzhin gyis ni g-yo med par //
translated: It should be stabilized and placed in the mind.

original: 'di yi chos ni dran par byed //
analyzed: 'di yi chos ni dran par byed //
translated: The Dharma of this one is rememberedüîΩWithout natural wavering.

original: chos kyi gzhi yi sa gzhi ni //
analyzed: chos kyi gzhi yi sa gzhi ni //
translated: The ground of the Dharma base

original: 'jig rten stong phrag rab tu g-yos //
analyzed: 'jig rten stong phrag rab tu g-yos //
translated: Shakes a thousand worlds.

original: sems med pa yis gzhi ni //üîΩbur shing 'khrul 'khor bzhin du btsir //
analyzed: sems med pa yis gzhi ni // bur shing 'khrul 'khor bzhin du btsir //
translated: The base without mindüîΩIs pressed like a sugarcane machine.

original: 'bru mar 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor //
analyzed: 'bru mar 'khrul 'khor bzhin du 'khor //
translated: It turns like an oil-mill.

original: de ltar sa ni rab tu g-yos //
analyzed: de ltar sa ni rab tu g-yos //
translated: Thus the earth shakes.

original: sa chen 'di g-yos pas dga' ba can gyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams ldang bar ma nus te /
analyzed: sa chen 'di g-yos pas dga' ba can gyi grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi rnams ldang bar ma nus te /
translated: By the shaking of this great earth, the people living in the city of RƒÅjag·πõha were unable to rise up.

original: bskal ba'i mtha' yi rlung gis bskyod pa'i sa'i shing chen po g-yos pa bzhin brgyal ba dang / bag med pas 'gyel par gyur to //
analyzed: bskal ba'i mtha' yi rlung gis bskyod pa'i sa'i shing chen po g-yos pa bzhin brgyal ba dang / bag med pas 'gyel par gyur to //
translated: He fainted, as if a great tree on the earth had been shaken by the wind at the end of an eon, and fell unconscious.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod ni 'dzad pa dang / phan tshun du 'phrad pa'i sgra dang / phye ma dang / dum bur gyur to //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i snod ni 'dzad pa dang / phan tshun du 'phrad pa'i sgra dang / phye ma dang / dum bur gyur to //
translated: The pots and so forth were destroyed, and the sound of their mutual collision, the dust, and the fragments [of the pots] were scattered.

original: skye bo thams cad 'jigs par gyur nas ston pa'i drung du nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: skye bo thams cad 'jigs par gyur nas ston pa'i drung du nye bar song ngo //
translated: All the people were frightened and went to the Teacher.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /

original: ji ltar / gzhan yang /
analyzed: ji ltar / gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams la kun nas khru brgyad cu pa'i sku tshad nyid kyi 'od du gyur to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gzhan rnams la kun nas khru brgyad cu pa'i sku tshad nyid kyi 'od du gyur to //
translated: the bodies of other buddhas are just eighty cubits tall and they have light.

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi sku'i 'od de lta bu nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid kyi sku'i 'od de lta bu nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: The light of the body of the Blessed One is not like that.

original: dus rtag tu stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'phro zhing @310a *//
analyzed: dus rtag tu stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su 'phro zhing @310a *//
translated: It always extends to a universe of ten thousand worlds,

original: gnas te / shing dang / sa dang / ri dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i phyogs lhag ma rnams dang / tshang bang la sogs pa gser gyis spras pa bzhin no; ;sku tshe'i tshad ni stong phrag dgu bcu'o //
analyzed: gnas te / shing dang / sa dang / ri dang / rgya mtsho la sogs pa'i phyogs lhag ma rnams dang / tshang bang la sogs pa gser gyis spras pa bzhin no; ;sku tshe'i tshad ni stong phrag dgu bcu'o //
translated: and the remaining directions, such as trees, earth, mountains, oceans, etc., are filled with it, like a chest filled with jewels. His life span is ninety thousand years.

original: de rnams kyi dus la zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa la rang gi 'od kyi snang ba'i nus pa med do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dus la zla ba dang / nyi ma la sogs pa la rang gi 'od kyi snang ba'i nus pa med do //
translated: In that time, the moon, the sun, etc., have no power to illuminate with their own light.

original: mtshan mo dang / nyin mo'i bye brag mi shes so //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang / nyin mo'i bye brag mi shes so //
translated: One cannot distinguish night from day.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyin mo nyi ma shar ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis rtag tu 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyin mo nyi ma shar ba bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis rtag tu 'gro bar byed do //
translated: The light of the Buddha always illuminates the world like the rising sun.

original: mtshan mo me tog zum pa dang / snga dro'i dus su bya rnams skad 'byin pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'jig rten pas nyin mtshan shes par byed do //
analyzed: mtshan mo me tog zum pa dang / snga dro'i dus su bya rnams skad 'byin pa la sogs pa la brten nas 'jig rten pas nyin mtshan shes par byed do //
translated: The world knows day and night by the closing of the flowers, by the singing of birds, etc.

original: yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan rnams la ci'i phyir 'di lta bu med pa yin nam /üîΩmed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs ba'i sangs rgyas gzhan rnams la ci'i phyir 'di lta bu med pa yin nam / med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Why do other perfect Buddhas not possess this?üîΩThey do possess it,

original: de rnams kyis kyang dgongs par gyur na /üîΩstong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang dgongs par gyur na / stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gyur pa'am /
translated: but they do not manifest it.

original: de bas lhag par yang 'od 'phro bar byed do //
analyzed: de bas lhag par yang 'od 'phro bar byed do //
translated: They emit their rays over a hundred thousand universes, or even more.

original: slar yang bcom ldan 'das bkra shis bzang po sngar gyi don du gnyer ba'i dbang gis te /üîΩgzhan gyi 'od 'dom gang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slar yang bcom ldan 'das bkra shis bzang po sngar gyi don du gnyer ba'i dbang gis te / gzhan gyi 'od 'dom gang pa bzhin no //
translated: The Blessed One, however, by the power of his former vow,üîΩemits his rays over a hundred leagues, like the rays of the sun.

original: sku'i 'od kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byas nas gnas so //
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid du stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab par byas nas gnas so //
translated: His rays are always spread out over a hundred thousand universes.

original: de'i byang chub sems dpa'i @310b spyod pa'i dus na thams cad sgrol bzhin du bdag nyid gnas so //
analyzed: de'i byang chub sems dpa'i @310b spyod pa'i dus na thams cad sgrol bzhin du bdag nyid gnas so //
translated: At the time of his bodhisattva conduct, he lived while liberating everyone.

original: de'i bu dang / bu mor bcas pa ri bo bham ga bzhin du ri la bzhugs so //
analyzed: de'i bu dang / bu mor bcas pa ri bo bham ga bzhin du ri la bzhugs so //
translated: Along with his sons and daughters, he lived on the mountain like Mount Bamga.

original: de nas mche ba gcig pa gdug pa can gyi gnod sbyin zhig gis skyes bu chen po sbyin pa gtong zhes thos nas bram ze'i gzugs kyis nye bar song ste sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bu mo slong ngo //
analyzed: de nas mche ba gcig pa gdug pa can gyi gnod sbyin zhig gis skyes bu chen po sbyin pa gtong zhes thos nas bram ze'i gzugs kyis nye bar song ste sems dpa' chen po'i drung du bu mo slong ngo //
translated: Then a one-toothed, evil yak·π£a, having heard that the great being was giving gifts, approached in the form of a brahman and asked for the great being's daughter in front of the great being.

original: sems dpa' chen pos bram ze la bu dang / bu mo sbyin no zhes bsams nas dga' ba dang / tshim pas chu'i mthar thug pa'i sa rnams g-yos so //
analyzed: sems dpa' chen pos bram ze la bu dang / bu mo sbyin no zhes bsams nas dga' ba dang / tshim pas chu'i mthar thug pa'i sa rnams g-yos so //
translated: The great being thought, I will give the brahman my son and daughter, and with joy and satisfaction, the earth shook up to the edge of the water.

original: de nas gnod sbyin 'chag pa'i gnas kyi mthar tsog pur rgyab rten la 'dug ste sems dpa' chen po la lta zhing 'dug go /
analyzed: de nas gnod sbyin 'chag pa'i gnas kyi mthar tsog pur rgyab rten la 'dug ste sems dpa' chen po la lta zhing 'dug go /
translated: Then the yak·π£a sat cross-legged at the edge of the walking place, looking at the great being.

original: de la des bu dang / bu mo byin pa dang / des la phug za ba bzhin du bu dang / bu mo zos nas gnod sbyin gyis skyes bu chen po de la blta ste /
analyzed: de la des bu dang / bu mo byin pa dang / des la phug za ba bzhin du bu dang / bu mo zos nas gnod sbyin gyis skyes bu chen po de la blta ste /
translated: The yak·π£a looked at the great man,

original: kha gdangs nas me 'bar ba bzhin du khrag gi rgyun 'bab bo //
analyzed: kha gdangs nas me 'bar ba bzhin du khrag gi rgyun 'bab bo //
translated: and as if fire were burning his mouth, a stream of blood flowed.

original: de'i kha mthong nas kyang skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi yid mi bde ba yang ma skyes par ngas byin pa shin tu legs pa gcig go zhes sems so //
analyzed: de'i kha mthong nas kyang skra'i rtse mo tsam gyi yid mi bde ba yang ma skyes par ngas byin pa shin tu legs pa gcig go zhes sems so //
translated: And when he saw his mouth, he thought, ‚ÄúI have given well, since not even a hair‚Äôs tip of regret has arisen.‚Äù

original: slar yang lus la mchog tu dga' ba chen po skyes so //
analyzed: slar yang lus la mchog tu dga' ba chen po skyes so //
translated: Again, supreme joy arose in his body.

original: de dag 'di la byin pa'i bsod nams kyi phan yon gyis ma 'ongs pa na 'di lta bu'i rim pa'i 'od zer 'phro bar don du gnyer ro //
analyzed: de dag 'di la byin pa'i bsod nams kyi phan yon gyis ma 'ongs pa na 'di lta bu'i rim pa'i 'od zer 'phro bar don du gnyer ro //
translated: By the benefit of the merit of giving them to him, in the future they will strive for the light rays of this kind of stage.

original: de la don du gnyer ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis sangs rgyas @311a *//
analyzed: de la don du gnyer ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis sangs rgyas @311a *//
translated: For the reason of striving for that, they will become buddhas.

original: su gyur nas sku'i 'od de phyi rol tu 'phro zhing de rnams la khyab par gnas so //
analyzed: su gyur nas sku'i 'od de phyi rol tu 'phro zhing de rnams la khyab par gnas so //
translated: Having become buddhas, their light will radiate externally and will abide pervading them.

original: gzhan yang / 'di'i sngar gyi mdzad pa yod pas de byang chub sems dpa'i dus su sangs rgyas gcig gi sku gdung gi mchod rten mthong nas sangs rgyas 'di'i sku gdung la bdag gis 'tsho ba yongs su gtang na rigs so snyam nas shing ras kyis dkris pa bzhin du lus
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'di'i sngar gyi mdzad pa yod pas de byang chub sems dpa'i dus su sangs rgyas gcig gi sku gdung gi mchod rten mthong nas sangs rgyas 'di'i sku gdung la bdag gis 'tsho ba yongs su gtang na rigs so snyam nas shing ras kyis dkris pa bzhin du lus
translated: Furthermore, because of his previous deeds, when he was a bodhisattva he saw a st≈´pa that contained the relics of a buddha and thought, ‚ÄúIt is right for me to give my life to the relics of this buddha.‚ÄùüîΩHe wrapped his body in cotton cloth,

original: thams cad gos gzhan gyis dkris shing rin po che'i cod ban gyon nas 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi snod du mar gyis bkang ste dar ras 'de stong phrag brgya btsugs nas mar me sbar te /
analyzed: thams cad gos gzhan gyis dkris shing rin po che'i cod ban gyon nas 'bum phrag gcig ri ba'i gser gyi snod du mar gyis bkang ste dar ras 'de stong phrag brgya btsugs nas mar me sbar te /
translated: put on a precious jeweled turban, filled a golden vessel worth a hundred thousand with butter, lit a thousand wicks of cotton cloth,

original: mgo'i steng du bzhag cing lus thams cad kyang 'bar bar byas nas sku gdung gi mchod rten la skor bar byed do //
analyzed: mgo'i steng du bzhag cing lus thams cad kyang 'bar bar byas nas sku gdung gi mchod rten la skor bar byed do //
translated: placed it on his head, and set his whole body on fire. He circumambulated the st≈´pa of the relics.

original: de ltar mtshan thog thag snga dro'i skya rengs shar gyi bar du 'bad pa byed pa nyid kyis ba spu'i khung bu tsam dro bar ma gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mtshan thog thag snga dro'i skya rengs shar gyi bar du 'bad pa byed pa nyid kyis ba spu'i khung bu tsam dro bar ma gyur te /
translated: He exerted himself in this way all night until dawn. Not even a pore of his skin became warm.

original: padma'i tshal du bzhugs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: padma'i tshal du bzhugs pa bzhin no //
translated: He is like one who dwells in a lotus grove.

original: chos zhes bya ba 'di rang nyid bsrung na chos bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba 'di rang nyid bsrung na chos bsrungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Dharma is protected by oneself, the Dharma is protected.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /üîΩchos bzhin bsrung na chos spyod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa / chos bzhin bsrung na chos spyod do //
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chos kyis bsgral na chos bzhin thob //
analyzed: chos kyis bsgral na chos bzhin thob //
translated: If the Dharma is protected in accordance with the Dharma, the Dharma is practiced.üîΩIf the Dharma is crossed over in accordance with the Dharma, the Dharma is attained.

original: legs par bsgral na chos phan yon //
analyzed: legs par bsgral na chos phan yon //
translated: If the Dharma is crossed over well, the Dharma is beneficial.

original: chos spyod ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: chos spyod ngan 'gror mi 'gro'o //
translated: Practicing the Dharma does not lead to lower realms.

original: 'di'i las kyi 'bras bu @311b bcom ldan 'das de sku'i 'od kyis stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab cing gnas so //
analyzed: 'di'i las kyi 'bras bu @311b bcom ldan 'das de sku'i 'od kyis stong phrag bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams khyab cing gnas so //
translated: The result of his action is that the Blessed One abides with his body pervading ten thousand world systems with light.

original: de'i tshe bdag cag ni byang chub sems dpa' shin tu sred ba zhes bya ba'i bram zer gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe bdag cag ni byang chub sems dpa' shin tu sred ba zhes bya ba'i bram zer gyur to //
translated: At that time, we were brahmins named Sutrishna, the Bodhisattvas.

original: des ston pa mgron du gnyer ba'i phyir drung du song ste chos snyan pa'i bshad ba thos nas /
analyzed: des ston pa mgron du gnyer ba'i phyir drung du song ste chos snyan pa'i bshad ba thos nas /
translated: He went to the teacher's presence to invite him, and hearing the pleasant explanation of the Dharma,

original: btsun ba / sang bdag gi gdugs tshod la byon pa zhu zhes so //
analyzed: btsun ba / sang bdag gi gdugs tshod la byon pa zhu zhes so //
translated: he said, Venerable One, please come to my midday meal tomorrow.

original: bram zer dge slong du tsam dgos zhes gsungs pa dang / btsun ba 'khor dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun du tsam bdog ces zhus so //
analyzed: bram zer dge slong du tsam dgos zhes gsungs pa dang / btsun ba 'khor dang bcas pa'i dge 'dun du tsam bdog ces zhus so //
translated: And he asked, How many monks are there in the community of monks with the reverend?

original: de'i tshe ston pa'i 'dus pa dang po nyid tsam yod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe ston pa'i 'dus pa dang po nyid tsam yod do //
translated: At that time, the Buddha's first assembly was just that much.üîΩ Therefore, he said, There are one billion,

original: de'i phyir bye ba stong phrag brgya yod ces gsungs pa dang / btsun pa 'khor thams cad dang bcas pa bdag gi khang par gdugs tshod la byon par zhu zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste bram zes sang don du gnyer cig /
analyzed: de'i phyir bye ba stong phrag brgya yod ces gsungs pa dang / btsun pa 'khor thams cad dang bcas pa bdag gi khang par gdugs tshod la byon par zhu zhes zhus pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ste bram zes sang don du gnyer cig /
translated: and the brahman said, Please come to my house for the midday meal with all your followers, and the Blessed One accepted. The brahman said, Please come tomorrow.

original: khang par 'gro zhing bsams pa /
analyzed: khang par 'gro zhing bsams pa /
translated: He went home and thought,

original: bdag gis dge slong 'di rnams la thug pa dang / zan dang / gos la sogs pa 'bul bar nus so //
analyzed: bdag gis dge slong 'di rnams la thug pa dang / zan dang / gos la sogs pa 'bul bar nus so //
translated: I can offer these monks rice gruel, food, clothes, and so forth.

original: bzhugs pa'i gnas ji lta bu zhes bsams so //
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i gnas ji lta bu zhes bsams so //
translated: He thought, What kind of dwelling should I prepare?

original: dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong gi steng na gnas pa'i lha'i rgyal po'i lva ba dmar po'i rdo leb la bzhugs pa na dro bar gyur te /
analyzed: dpag tshad brgyad khri bzhi stong gi steng na gnas pa'i lha'i rgyal po'i lva ba dmar po'i rdo leb la bzhugs pa na dro bar gyur te /
translated: He thought, I will prepare a dwelling on a red coral slab, the king of the gods, who lives eighty-four thousand leagues above.

original: brgya byin gang zhig bdag gi gnas 'dir 'dod ba'i sems su zhig la yod snyam pa @312a *//
analyzed: brgya byin gang zhig bdag gi gnas 'dir 'dod ba'i sems su zhig la yod snyam pa @312a *//
translated: ≈öakra thought, Who is it that wants my abode?

original: dang / lha'i dbang pos lha'i mig gis bltas pas skyes bu chen po de mthong nas /üîΩ'di ltar shin tu sred pa'i bram ze sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun mgron du gnyer te /
analyzed: dang / lha'i dbang pos lha'i mig gis bltas pas skyes bu chen po de mthong nas / 'di ltar shin tu sred pa'i bram ze sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun mgron du gnyer te /
translated: The lord of the gods looked with the divine eye and saw that great man.

original: bzhugs pa'i gnas kyang bsams kyi /
analyzed: bzhugs pa'i gnas kyang bsams kyi /
translated: He thought, This great man has invited the Buddha and the community of monks for a meal, and he is looking for a place to hold it.

original: bdag kyang der phyin nas bsod nams kyi cha len par rigs so snyam nas shing mkhan gyi gzugs su sprul to //
analyzed: bdag kyang der phyin nas bsod nams kyi cha len par rigs so snyam nas shing mkhan gyi gzugs su sprul to //
translated: It would be fitting for me to go there and take a share of the merit. He transformed himself into a woodcutter.

original: ste'u dang / dgra sta blangs te skyes bu chen po'i mdun du gnas par gyur nas /
analyzed: ste'u dang / dgra sta blangs te skyes bu chen po'i mdun du gnas par gyur nas /
translated: He took an ax and a saw and stood in front of the great man.

original: gang su zhig kho bo la gla byin te las ka byed pa yod ces smras so //
analyzed: gang su zhig kho bo la gla byin te las ka byed pa yod ces smras so //
translated: He said, Who will pay me to do some work?

original: skyes bu chen pos gzigs te /
analyzed: skyes bu chen pos gzigs te /
translated: The great man looked at him and said,

original: gang zhig las ka byed nus zhes gsungs pa dang / bdag gis mi shes ba'i bzo med do //
analyzed: gang zhig las ka byed nus zhes gsungs pa dang / bdag gis mi shes ba'i bzo med do //
translated: Who can do some work? There is no craft that I do not know.

original: khang ba 'am; bsti gnas sam /
analyzed: khang ba 'am; bsti gnas sam /
translated: Build a house or a temple,

original: gang zhig cung zad byed pa'i bzo de bdag gis byed kyang nus so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zhig cung zad byed pa'i bzo de bdag gis byed kyang nus so zhes zer ro //
translated: ‚ÄúI can do whatever work you can do.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva said,

original: de'i phyir nga la las su bya ba yod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir nga la las su bya ba yod de /
translated: ‚ÄúI have work to do.

original: kho bos sang 'phags pa las bye ba phrag brgya pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun mgron du gnyer to //
analyzed: kho bos sang 'phags pa las bye ba phrag brgya pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun mgron du gnyer to //
translated: I have invited the community of monks led by the Buddha to a meal tomorrow.

original: de rnams bzhugs pa'i gnas byed par nus sam /
analyzed: de rnams bzhugs pa'i gnas byed par nus sam /
translated: Can you prepare a place for them to stay?‚Äù

original: smras pa / bdag gis bgyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa / bdag gis bgyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI can do that.‚Äù

original: bdag la gla ster nus sam /
analyzed: bdag la gla ster nus sam /
translated: ‚ÄúCan you pay me for it?‚Äù

original: bu; bdag gis nus so //
analyzed: bu; bdag gis nus so //
translated: ‚ÄúI can do that.‚Äù

original: legs so zhes bya ba legs par byas so //üîΩphyin nas sa phyogs gcig @312b bltas nas dpag tshad bcu gnyis sam /
analyzed: legs so zhes bya ba legs par byas so // phyin nas sa phyogs gcig @312b bltas nas dpag tshad bcu gnyis sam /
translated: ‚ÄúVery well, then.‚Äù

original: bcu gsum pa'i tshad kyi sa phyogs gcig tu zad bar sngon po'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du steng mnyam par byas so //
analyzed: bcu gsum pa'i tshad kyi sa phyogs gcig tu zad bar sngon po'i dkyil 'khor bzhin du steng mnyam par byas so //
translated: He went to the place and looked around. He made the ground as level as the palm of his hand, as smooth as a blue-black stone, twelve or thirteen yojanas in size.

original: des 'di rnams kyi gnas tsam du rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i bsti gnas sa 'og nas phyung nas bya'o zhes bsam zhing blta'o //
analyzed: des 'di rnams kyi gnas tsam du rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i bsti gnas sa 'og nas phyung nas bya'o zhes bsam zhing blta'o //
translated: He thought, I will have a temple made out of the seven precious substances, and I will have it built from the ground up.

original: de ma thag par sa gzhi brtol nas bsti gnas grub bo //üîΩde ni gser las byung ba'i ka ba rnams la dngul las byung ba'i ka gzhu'i steng du gser las byung ba'i gdung ngo //
analyzed: de ma thag par sa gzhi brtol nas bsti gnas grub bo // de ni gser las byung ba'i ka ba rnams la dngul las byung ba'i ka gzhu'i steng du gser las byung ba'i gdung ngo //
translated: As soon as he had this thought, the temple was built.üîΩThe pillars were made of gold, the crossbeams of silver, and the beams of gold.

original: nor bu'i ka ba la byi ru'i rang bzhin no; ;byu ru'i ka pa la nor bu'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bu'i ka ba la byi ru'i rang bzhin no; ;byu ru'i ka pa la nor bu'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The pillars were made of jewels, the crossbeams of coral, and the beams of crystal.

original: rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i ka ba la rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i ka gzhu nyid do //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i ka ba la rin po che sna bdun las byung ba'i ka gzhu nyid do //
translated: The pillars were made of the seven precious substances, the crossbeams of the seven precious substances, and the beams of the seven precious substances.

original: de nas bsti gnas kyi bar bar du g-yer kha'i dra ba 'phyang ba la blta zhing de bltas tsam nyid na dra ba 'phyang /
analyzed: de nas bsti gnas kyi bar bar du g-yer kha'i dra ba 'phyang ba la blta zhing de bltas tsam nyid na dra ba 'phyang /
translated: He looked at the temple, and in between the pillars there were hanging nets of bells. As soon as he looked at them, the nets of bells rang.

original: gang la rlung gis bskyod pa de la yan lag lnga pa'i rol mo sgra snyan sgrogs te lha'i glu dbyangs sgrogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la rlung gis bskyod pa de la yan lag lnga pa'i rol mo sgra snyan sgrogs te lha'i glu dbyangs sgrogs pa bzhin no //
translated: When the wind blows, the five-part music resounds, like the divine songs.

original: bar bar du spos kyi phreng ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'phyang ba la sems zhing phreng ba 'phyang ba la'o //
analyzed: bar bar du spos kyi phreng ba dang / me tog gi phreng ba 'phyang ba la sems zhing phreng ba 'phyang ba la'o //
translated: Here and there, garlands of incense and garlands of flowers hang down, and the mind is suspended in the garlands.

original: bye ba stong phrag brgya'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi grangs kyis stan dang / rgyab rten rnams sa gzhi la brtol nas byung bar bsams so //
